page.title: 01The Kirdford Area.
page.content: The village of Kirdford is between Petworth and Billingshurst in the county of West Sussex and is 75 feet above sea level.It is about 20 miles from the sea. Kirdford is a small quiet village in beautiful Wealden countryside. A tributary of the river Arun runs through the area. It is said that Kirdford received it's name from a man called Cyerend who lived near the ford in the twelfth century.He was well known so the people who lived near-by decided to call the ford after him.They called it Cyerend ford.Over the years it has changed to Kirdford which is what the village is called today.
